p: The reduction of shallow suitable areas and increase of deeper habitats suggest the potential of M. harttii for using mesophotic reefs as refugia, ensuring its subsistence. However, the DRRH is more adequate for species with wide depth distribution ranges [ 117] and presupposes larvae exchange between deep and shallow populations [ 135], which have been demonstrated to be local and species-specific [ 136]. Despite M. harttii is particularly representative in shallow waters (2â€“6 m), scattered records show this species occupying deeper reefs (up to 80 m) [ 20, 94, 137] ( S6 Appendix), which reinforces the potential of the species to occupy deep mesophotic areas.
